title: Arrival at Walston
setting: Walston Starport - a small but functional facility serving this frontier world
description: The Autumn Gold touches down at Walston's modest starport. Through the viewports, you see a dusty landing field, a cluster of low buildings, and beyond them, a small town under a thin, hazy sky. The journey is over - but the real work is about to begin.
atmosphere: Frontier practicality. The air has a slight metallic tang from the thin atmosphere. Everything is functional, nothing is fancy.
narrator_prompt: The Autumn Gold has arrived at Walston after two weeks of travel. The travellers disembark with their cargo - three heavy flight cases containing the repair kit for Highndry. The starport is small but functional: a landing field, a terminal building, customs, and the beginnings of Startown beyond. The thin atmosphere gives everything a slightly hazy quality.

pc_knows: You've arrived at Walston after two weeks aboard the Autumn Gold
You have three heavy flight cases of repair equipment to collect
You need to pass through customs before entering Walston proper
The ship Highndry is somewhere on this world - you'll need to find out exactly where
opening_context.pc_goal: Collect your cargo, clear customs, and begin your search for Highndry

scene_beats.narrator: Captain Corelli bids you farewell at the airlock. 'Good luck finding your ship,' she says. 'Walston's a small place - someone will know where it is.' The ramp extends to the dusty tarmac, and you step onto Walston soil for the first time.

scene_beats.description: Collect the repair kit crates from cargo hold
scene_beats.narrator: The cargo handlers wheel out three heavy flight cases - your repair kit. Circuit panels, tools, diagnostic equipment, spare parts. Everything you need to get Highndry flying again. The cases are bulky and awkward - too heavy to carry comfortably by hand.

scene_beats.description: Gvoudzon the Vargr porter offers assistance
scene_beats.narrator: A Vargr in work clothes approaches, eyeing your cargo with professional interest. 'Heavy crates, friend! You need help with those? I'm Gvoudzon - I carry luggage, and I know everyone on Walston. Whatever you need, I know someone.'
The customs checkpoint awaits. A bored-looking human officer sits behind a counter. Law Level 8 - Walston is strict about weapons, though cursory about most other things.

exits.back_to_ship: Cannot reboard - the Autumn Gold will be departing soon

repair-kit-crates.description: Three heavy flight cases containing circuit panels, tools, diagnostic unit, and spare parts

notes.cargo_reminder: The repair kit crates are too heavy to carry comfortably. The porter Gvoudzon can help transport them to the hotel.
notes.porter_hook: Gvoudzon is a key contact - he knows everyone on Walston and can connect the PCs to various resources.
